I already tried to get the Developers to fix the compasses but apparently they can't at this stage. As for the kits I have talked with Fouled recently and we did agree that walls kits need to be redone. I'm open to any suggestions for new kits and for certain kits to be removed. Message me on Communy Slack if you have any ideas as to what Kits need to be redone, removed and any ideas for new kits.

As for other glitches please report them on Github since most of the time we aren't actually aware of these things.

replies.body: Although I am completely aware that this discussion is supposed to be mainly focusing on walls and how to improve it; I would also like to bring attention to other gamemodes that are lacking it. Before I say these things, I would like to say how fully aware I am of how much developers, admins, sr moderators, moderators, jr moderators, map developers, jr map developers, refs, yes, even refs, and the community itself are already putting into making avicus a better place. Although I could and am fully capable of doing so, I am not going to be one of those people who say how amazing and better avicus was before the avicore update. When it was still McZone. The game types that I would like to bring attention to are the following. Survival games; as of right now, the servers are completely glitched and you are not able to start a game. But even when they are up, the maps are dull, and the loot is as well. The community should start making sg maps too. (not me though, bc im lazy and i suck at building anyways) They should also add some spice to loot tables, making the games more fun and interesting. CTH as well. The kits are in need of an update, and people like Passion_ pick demo, and use their donator rank to join, throw a grenade, leave, join, throw another, and repeat. Besides that, nothing is really wrong with CTH. But if you were to give it some attention, you would make the user Myv very happy. Nexus is also in need of kit change, as well as better spawn protection. I don't even wanna talk about CTW... And the nebula maps are in need of updates, as you have already began doing. I also see no reason for calling the server "throwback" throwback because it is the server that everybody plays on, and should just be considered a regular rotation. I hope you take this constructive criticism as I hope you do, and not as me being a male reproductive organ. please and thank you.

replies.body: I agree with you. Although walls was not my first gamemode, I was introduced into by some attractive players, and I fell in love with it, and the players, ever since. For a little bit, these players, myself included, were able to revive walls, but ever since the compasses were broken again, the walls community has been on a downward decline, and now, it breaks my heart to see it empty almost all the time. Abandoned by the people who once loved it. I only hope that it blossoms once again to what it once was, and that it doesn't decline to the point of being removed from the server for inactivity. please and thank you.

I only hope that it blossoms once again to what it once was, and that it doesn't decline to the point of being removed from the server for inactivity. please and thank you.

replies.body: Believe it or not, I also do not like burritos, I was merely hoping to get you to buy something other than moderator.  I am aware that you were going to buy moderator with 3 pesos, as I stated in my first paragraph in the fifth line, which extends to the sixth line, "I wish you luck in your purchase of moderator and beyond."  The word 'purchased' is used, implying that you are going to exchange some form of currency, in this case, pesos, in order to obtain a product, service or position.  Of course, you are purchasing a position, the rank of moderator on the avicus network, so it is not a product nor a service.  Now that we have cleared up that amusing misunderstanding, we can continue our civilized and refined engagement upon the topic of the ban of WhatLiesBeaneath.  As stated previously, I do not find Burritos in any form, appealing to the tongue, If you purchase the fine dessert common referred to as "donuts," then my opinion may sway in the position which you seem to stand upon.  But I must appeal to you, think about the walls community, banning someone for such a trifle matter will only reflect a poor atmosphere for our community that is figuratively as small as an atom. I appreciate your reading of this small consideration.

replies.body: Topic you say? Lets fix walls up a bit. Maps are useless because the active people who play it (about everyone, or the people who play it once every month or so) already know the maps, the routes, the ores, the strategies. There are about at max three players per team. These maps are designed for a full fledged 7 7 7 7 game, if not more. I came to this server looking for fun active walls games to compete on with acquaintances or rather strangers. Not people who know all maps by heart like I do. (not really I don't try as much as I did) still, I still think walls has potential and hasn't peaked yet. Three years ago there were three lobbies with 20 people each in them, all not knowing what the next map can be, trying to get to level 50 so they can prestige and prestige again. Now, its you have access to all kits no matter how good/bad you are. No ranking to look forward to if you did even play, no point really, except the few credits you will earn because there are no potential kills because there is no one even in thr game, but, if avicus can cooperate with the players, i think it will do much better as a community. Thanks for reading this Whereas I am turning 6 on monday
